content:
Is this a setting we expect people to use other than for testing? If not, can it just be replaced with a "test" button that sends a test notification?

Having a test button would be useful for the other types of notifications as well (desktop, audible, email)

I love getting mobile notifications for some of my streams even though I’m online.

I don’t want to miss a conversation because I got up for a few minutes or was having a desk conversation and not looking at my screen to see the notification.
I guess the test button is a good idea in addition to the option?

interesting!
Though to clarify, the "when online" option currently only applies to PMs and @-mentions.
I am wondering if we should differentiate between being 'online' on the web vs mobile.

Our people using mobile are currently complaining that they're not getting enough notifications on mobile -- they seem to want (by default) notifications every time a message comes in, unless the mobile app or the web app are explicitly in-focus.

So in the Settings -> Notifications I have checked Mobile Notifications and Mobile Notifications Always options for my username. Then in a stream where I want to always see notifications for all posts I can go to Stream Settings and check Mobile Notifications. With this combo I always get a mobile notification of posts to that stream regardless of if I am offline, online, or mentioned in the message.
I'm not sure if that interaction between stream notification and personal notifications was intended. But for select streams it's very useful.

People definitely use the "mobile notifications even when online" feature (there have been times when it's what I wanted, for use cases like when I don't have my headphones on and am online but not looking at Zulip, it can be nice to get the signal of my phone buzzing in my pocket)
I think it'd be great to add a "test" button for mobile notifications.
got it. And just to clarify: does that setting apply to all the mobile notifications you would have gotten if you were offline, or just the PMs and at-mentions?
From a code structure perspective, I would expect that it applies to all notifications (logically, it controls whether we require you to be online).

ok, and sounds like that matches Scott's experience as well. Should we move the setting out of the PM section into the "Other" section?
pasted image
@Rishi Gupta possibly, but it may not be as simple as that. I'm not sure we send mobile notifications for streams if you don't have it on for PMs (I haven't checked)
So that might be a worse representation of the actual behavior. Needs some investigation.
